title: How to Convert HTML to Markdown: Simplify Your Content Workflow
content:
## Introduction Converting HTML to Markdown is essential for content migration, simplifying complex markup, and creating portable documentation. Our free HTML to Markdown converter transforms HTML code into clean, readable Markdown that you can edit and maintain easily. ## Key Takeaways - Convert complex HTML to simple Markdown - Preserve links, images, and formatting - Handle tables and code blocks - Clean output ready for editing - Perfect for content migration ## What is HTML to Markdown Conversion? HTML to Markdown conversion takes structured HTML markup and transforms it into lightweight Markdown syntax. Complex HTML elements become simple, readable text: | HTML | Markdown | |------|----------| | `

Title

` | # Title | | `bold` | **bold** | | `text` | [text](url) | | `
  • item
` | - item | ## Why Convert HTML to Markdown? ### 1. Content Migration Move content to Markdown-based systems: - Migrate blogs to static site generators - Move documentation to Git repositories - Transfer CMS content to new platforms - Archive web content in readable format ### 2. Simplify Editing Markdown is easier to work with: - No angle brackets to manage - Readable without rendering - Version control friendly - Simple syntax to remember ### 3. Portable Content Markdown works everywhere: - GitHub and GitLab - Static site generators - Documentation platforms - Note-taking apps ### 4. Clean Up Messy HTML Reduce complexity: - Remove unnecessary styling - Strip inline CSS - Eliminate redundant tags - Focus on content structure ## Common Use Cases ### Blog Migration - Export posts from WordPress - Move to Jekyll or Hugo - Convert old HTML articles - Preserve content structure ### Documentation Projects - Convert existing docs to Markdown - Prepare for documentation sites - Create GitHub README files - Build knowledge bases ### Content Archiving - Save web pages as Markdown - Create readable archives - Preserve article content - Build reference libraries ### Email Template Processing - Extract content from HTML emails - Simplify newsletter content - Create editable templates - Prepare content for reuse ## Step-by-Step Guide ### Step 1: Input HTML Paste your HTML code into the input area: - Full HTML documents - HTML fragments - Rich text pasted from editors - Code from view-source ### Step 2: Convert Click Convert to transform HTML to Markdown. The tool: - Parses HTML structure - Identifies semantic elements - Generates Markdown syntax - Cleans up output ### Step 3: Review Output Check the converted Markdown: - Verify formatting preserved - Check links and images - Review list structure - Confirm table conversion ### Step 4: Copy or Download - Copy to clipboard for immediate use - Download as .md file - Use in your projects ## Features and Capabilities ### Element Conversion | HTML Element | Markdown Output | |--------------|------------------| | h1-h6 | # to ###### | | p | Plain paragraph | | strong/b | **bold** | | em/i | *italic* | | a | [text](url) | | img | ![alt](src) | | ul/ol | - or 1. lists | | blockquote | > quoted | | pre/code | ``` code ``` | | table | Pipe table | ### Handling Complex HTML - Nested lists preserved - Table structure maintained - Code blocks with language - Inline elements combined ### Cleanup Features - Strips inline styles - Removes classes and IDs - Ignores script and style tags - Cleans whitespace ## Best Practices and Tips ### Before Converting **Prepare your HTML:** - Remove unnecessary wrapper divs - Check for semantic elements - Verify content is complete - Note any special formatting ### After Converting **Review and clean up:** - Check heading hierarchy - Verify link targets - Test image references - Format code blocks properly ### Common Adjustments | Issue | Solution | |-------|----------| | Extra line breaks | Consolidate blank lines | | Missing formatting | Check source HTML | | Broken links | Verify URL encoding | | Missing images | Check relative paths | ### Handling Edge Cases **Complex layouts:** - May require manual adjustment - Focus on content over layout - Simplify complex structures **Inline styles:** - Stripped during conversion - Add back as needed - Consider Markdown limitations ## Understanding Conversion Quality ### What Converts Well - Semantic HTML elements - Standard text formatting - Simple lists and tables - Standard links and images ### What May Need Work - Complex nested structures - Custom formatting via CSS - Interactive elements - Layout-focused markup ### Cannot Be Converted - JavaScript functionality - CSS styling - Form elements - Embedded media ## Comparison with Alternatives | Feature | Our Tool | Turndown | Pandoc | |---------|----------|----------|--------| | Cost | Free | Free | Free | | Interface | Web GUI | Library | CLI | | Tables | Yes | Plugin | Yes | | Customization | Basic | Extensive | Extensive | | Ease of Use | Very Easy | Moderate | Moderate | ## Frequently Asked Questions ### Will inline styles be preserved? No, inline CSS is stripped during conversion. Markdown does not support styling. You will need to apply styles separately after conversion. ### How are complex tables handled? Tables are converted to Markdown pipe table syntax. Complex tables with colspan/rowspan may need manual adjustment. ### What happens to div and span elements? Div and span elements are typically stripped, with only their text content preserved. Use semantic HTML elements for better conversion. ### Can I convert entire web pages? Yes, but navigation, headers, footers, and sidebars will be included. You may want to extract just the main content before converting. ### Are image paths preserved? Yes, image URLs are preserved exactly as they appear in the HTML. Relative paths remain relative. ### What about special characters? HTML entities are decoded to their character equivalents. Special Markdown characters are escaped when necessary. ## Conclusion Converting HTML to Markdown simplifies content management and enables easy editing, version control, and platform migration. Our free HTML to Markdown converter handles the transformation instantly while preserving your content structure. Start converting your HTML to clean, portable Markdown today.
